title: This Feedback is interesting.
body:
https://image.prntscr.com/image/ieri9hz0Qbeo3RAF-BU-kA.png

Why would one Strongly Agree/Disagree to having a Mobile Phone.

Also why does Riot need to know in the first place?

replies.body: As Suicidal Jester said, it's likely to do with the mobile app. Riot are probably trying to get an idea on how many people are likely to use the app so they can figure out how much time, effort and money they could reasonably put into that, rather than other "stuff" that may or may not be deemed higher priority. It's definitely been poorly worded, what it should say is something along the lines of "Companion apps for mobile phones add to the enjoyment and/or accessibility of games", or just be a simple "yes/no" question, though the latter gives Riot a lot less to work with.
Who cares about a stupid mobile app when the game is unbalanced and broken?

Using someone's in-game rank is a poor excuse, I've been playing this game for 4 years and I've seen all the changes that this game has gone through. Remember that someone might be of a lower rank because they have good game knowledge but very shit mechanics. Also if you believe me to be wrong then explain why the item Ardent Censer isn't broken? And why challlengers and pros also agree that it should of been nerfed ages ago? Or have you just completely dodged the question and used my rank as an excuse to form a prejudicial opinion of my knowledge?

there are 3 types of people who use the mobile app.

1. People who installed it because they thought it would be cool, were disappointed, but can't be bothered to uninstall it.
2. People who use it to keep an eye on friends online, but are hoping for more features.
3. People who installed it, and then forgot they installed it.

If anyone has a different use for it, please do tell.

I used to use it and used it quite often actually :)

And the sad thing is, that with this it does make me feel Riot is going to waste time on a mobile app, when realistically, you could just use one of the tons of mobile apps that already exist, and Riot could just open their API more and allow Phone apps to be made by the community, and that would end up being a better choice.

Just wanted to press upon the point that Riot already has a League of Legends "Friends" app. If there's a demand for certain features from the community, I imagine they'd want to be able to place it in some sort of prioritization list. Just my thoughts on the matter.

Alternatively, they could be gauging whether mobile 2FA is the best approach. Again, it's really hard to tell what they're gathering the metric for, but I'm sure they'll use it to make informed decisions.

I mean i get Riot wanting to have control of the phone app, but again it feels like a bit of a waste of resources when the community could easily do similar (if not somewhat better to an extent because of no deadlines or limits) things with just access to the API.

I don't necessarily see the reason why it has to be a Riot App instead of a App made by community members like there already is.

Be better if we could just somehow go linking it to our accounts in some way that Riot can make sure is secure.
